items.title: Fintech lending 2.0 shifts focus from blitz scale to depth and discipline
items.summary: Founders who participated in a panel discussion on digital lending’s next chapter, at Mint’s annual BFSI Summit on Friday, said the sector is moving away from blitz-scale expansion to stronger liability management, unit economics, and deeper monetization of existing customers.

items.title: Masdar pulls the plug on going private with ReNew
items.summary: Masdar has withdrawn its nearly $1 billion offer to take ReNew Energy Global private, causing a significant drop in the company's stock price. The move by the leading investor in a four-member consortium effectively terminates the proposed transaction, disappointing shareholders seeking an exit opportunity.

items.title: Dollar edges lower against yen in week packed with data releases and central bank decisions
items.summary: GLOBAL-FOREX/ (CORRECTED, UPDATE 6):REFILE-FOREX-Dollar edges lower against yen in week packed with data releases and central bank decisions

items.title: RBC Warns of ‘Finite’ Market-Maker Capital For ETF Share Classes
items.summary: Market-making firms in the $13 trillion exchange-traded fund industry may come under strain amid a potential wave of new listings in 2026, with US regulators poised to allow asset managers to offer ETFs as share classes of mutual funds.

items.title: India seeks WTO talks with EU on ferroalloys
items.summary: India has requested consultations with the EU under the WTO's safeguard agreement concerning new import measures on certain ferroalloys. The EU's decision, effective immediately, introduces country-specific tariff-rate quotas, limiting duty-free imports and increasing tariffs for volumes exceeding these quotas.

items.title: Global stock index dips ahead of key US data, central bank decisions
items.summary: GLOBAL-MARKETS/ (WRAPUP 6, PIX):GLOBAL MARKETS-Global stock index dips ahead of key US data, central bank decisions

items.title: Unemployment rate falls to 4.7% in November, lowest since April
items.summary: India's unemployment rate dropped to 4.7% in November, its lowest since April, with joblessness declining in both rural and urban areas. The overall decrease was more pronounced among women, and labor force participation also reached its highest point since April, indicating strengthening labor market conditions.

items.title: Dream11 exits IPL jerseys as teams sign new principal sponsors
items.summary: Several IPL franchises are set to unveil new principal sponsors for the upcoming season, with deals priced 15-20% higher than previous contracts. This shift sees legacy brands like Birla Estates and Hero Vida replacing gaming companies such as Dream11, reflecting a recalibration in cricket sponsorships.

items.title: Delhi HC bars RSPL's Leayan Global from using 'power flex' for footwear
items.summary: Upholding the order passed by its single-judge bench in 2019, Justice C Hari Shankar and Justice Om Prakash Shukla of a division bench said there is a deceptive similarity between Kanpur-based Leayan Global's "Power Flex" mark and Bata India's "Power" mark, and both marks were being used for goods which are similar, thus there is a likelihood of confusion.

items.title: Trial by fire: Over 60% of pharma SMEs may be forced to shut shop
items.summary: India is estimated to have about 12,000 drug manufacturing units. The units that risk being shut down account for about Rs 75,000 crore of India's Rs 2.5 lakh crore domestic drug market, the executives said. This may result in shortages of antibiotics, anti-hypertensives, anti-inflammatory medicines, analgesic, anti-cough and cold tablets, diabetes drugs and general medicines, among others, said a pharma industry expert, speaking on the condition of anonymity. "The shortages of medicines will be seen across the country. Many of these units also cater to government supplies along with supplies

items.title: 'Retail inflation may rise to 1.5% in Dec': Nomura
items.summary: Retail inflation is predicted to climb to 1.5 percent in December. This rise is due to base effects and easing food deflation. Nomura forecasts inflation to average 1.9 percent in FY26. The Reserve Bank of India's Monetary Policy Committee is expected to cut rates by 25 basis points in April.

items.title: Cyber cover rush gathers pace as digital risks mount
items.summary: The time taken to put a cyber insurance cover in place has shrunk dramatically to just a few days from six to seven months earlier, as companies move quickly to hedge against operational disruption, regulatory fines and potential indemnification exposure, said insurers and brokers.

items.title: India strengthens position in digital service exports: Report
items.summary: India, the Philippines, and several African economies are strengthening their business process and digital service exports, according to The Global Value Chain Development Report 2025. This shift highlights the growing importance of services in manufacturing and indicates that global value chains remain crucial, with GVC trade declining only marginally from its peak.

items.title: Winter fog disrupts air travel as 300 flights cancelled across north India
items.summary: Dense winter fog blanketed north India on Monday, leading to the cancellation of at least 300 flights and hundreds of delays. Delhi airport alone saw 228 flights cancelled due to low visibility, impacting thousands of passengers. Airlines like IndiGo and Air India confirmed significant disruptions, with affected customers being notified.

items.title: SC rejects plea seeking probe, refunds over IndiGo flight chaos
items.summary: The Supreme Court declined to hear a public interest litigation concerning mass IndiGo flight cancellations. The court directed the petitioner to approach the Delhi High Court, which is already addressing the issue. Thousands of passengers were stranded due to the cancellations.

items.title: Natural gas loses industrial buyers as liquid fuels turn cheaper
items.summary: City gas distributors are facing challenges acquiring new industrial and commercial customers due to natural gas being costlier than competing liquid fuels. New factory connections dropped 39% and commercial additions fell 17% in the first half of the financial year, as cheaper LPG and propane are displacing natural gas.

items.title: Nov wholesale prices remain in deflation zone for second month
items.summary: Wholesale prices stayed in deflation for November, falling 0.3 percent. This marks the second month of deflation. Food articles, mineral oils, crude petroleum, and natural gas were cheaper than last year. Retail inflation saw a slight increase. Experts suggest WPI may soon return to inflation territory as base effects weaken.

items.title: IndusInd Bank moves to claw back bonuses from ex-top brass
items.summary: The bank has not yet finalised the clawback period, which is likely to span two to three years. The proposed action is based on findings from multiple internal and external reports commissioned by the bank, including reviews conducted by Grant Thornton, PwC and EY, they said. The three executives were at the helm of IndusInd when the non-state bank discovered accounting discrepancies in internal derivative trades, which caused it a loss of about Rs 2,000 crore.

items.title: US trade deal in final lap: Commerce secretary Rajesh Agrawal
items.summary: India and the US are nearing a framework trade deal. Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal stated that further formal discussions may not be needed. Negotiations with the European Union on a free trade agreement have entered a difficult phase. India and the EU are working to resolve differences, including the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism.

items.title: Defaults on the rise in micro loans over property
items.summary: According to the report, delinquency levels in the micro-LAP segment rose by 45 basis points (bps) year-on-year to 3.3% as of September 2025. Early delinquencies-measured as loans 90 days or more past due within 12 months on book-increased by 29 bps YoY to 2.2% for originations in the quarter ended September 2024. This is significantly higher than overall LAP early delinquencies of 1.6%.

items.title: Deduction on foreign bank's 'head office expenditure' capped at 5% of income: Supreme Court
items.summary: If any foreign company operating in India incurs any expenses outside India but that is also related to Indian business, Section 44C allows the deduction for that expense, but it is subject to the restriction provided in the provision. The restriction limits the expense to the tune of 5% of adjusted total income of the Indian business, it said.

items.title: RBI unlikely to play Santa again in February
items.summary: Consumer price inflation picked up to 0.71% YoY in November from 0.25% in October, driven by persistent food price deflation and weak core inflation. Most economists said headline inflation appears to have bottomed out in October on account of lower food prices and one-time GST cut adjustment and expect it to inch up but will be below RBI’s 4% medium-term target. RBI has cut the repo rate by 125 bps since the easing cycle began in February stating that it is to support growth as inflation remained benign.

items.title: November goods exports leap 19%; with over $38-billion shipments, trade gap shrinks to 5-month low
items.summary: The strong export growth, the fastest since June 2022, and a 1.88% fall in imports to $62.66 billion drove the trade deficit to a five-month low of $24.53 billion.

items.title: Cloud is the limit for Hyderabad's office market now
items.summary: Hyderabad's property market is set for a boom. Major tech companies are investing billions in cloud and AI infrastructure across India. This will boost demand for office spaces and land. Hyderabad, with its supportive policies and infrastructure, is a key beneficiary. This trend will reshape India's real estate and digital infrastructure landscape.

items.title: Win Diesel: M&M sells half the cars using the fuel in India now
items.summary: The XUV700 and Thar maker dominates the diesel PV market, with its share projected to increase to 56% this year, from 53% in 2024 and 34% in 2022, according to Equirus Research data.

items.title: Bitcoin Plunges Below $86,000 While Sinking Toward Year's Lows
items.summary: The largest cryptocurrency has continued to fall with other risk assets in recent weeks but hasn’t rebounded when they have, breaking its usual upside correlation.

items.title: Gold surges ₹4,000 to record ₹137,600
items.summary: Gold prices have reached a record high of Rs 1,37,600 per 10 grams in New Delhi. This surge follows firm global cues and renewed safe-haven demand. International spot gold also saw a significant rise. Silver prices remained stable. Gold imports saw a dip in November after a substantial increase in October.

items.title: India, Philippines, others strengthen position in digital service exports: Global Value Chain Development Report
items.summary: India and the Philippines are boosting digital services exports. Global supply chains are proving resilient, adapting to new economic and political needs. Digital trade and data flows are crucial for this adaptation. Countries are exploring carbon pricing to decarbonise supply chains. The automotive sector is transforming with the rise of electric vehicles, led by China's production dominance.

items.title: Dhurandhar Craze Hits Kashmir's Small Towns, Theatres Full From Pulwama To Shopian
items.summary: With audience flocking in to the halls in both these regions, a renewed demand for big-screen entertainment and cinema-going in towns without multiplex infrastructure can be seen.

items.summary: The purchase would mark the first by the airline that’s owned by the Sanjay Ghodawat Group, which has interests in areas spanning consumer products, education, retail and mining.

items.summary: SBI’s board is led by the Chairman and supported by four managing directors overseeing the bank’s key verticals.

items.title: Clean air, open land redraw luxury housing demand in India
items.summary: Wealthy Indians are buying their second homes outside cities. Clean air and less crowded living are now priorities. Destinations like Goa and Alibaug are seeing more interest. These homes are used for longer stays and remote work. Developers are responding with more low-density projects. This trend is changing the luxury housing market.

items.title: B Sairam appointed Coal India CMD
items.summary: A mining engineer from NIT Raipur, Sairam brings over three decades of experience across mine operations, logistics, project planning and regulatory affairs.

items.title: Battery energy storage cost falls to Rs 2.1/unit from Rs 10.18 in 2022-23: Power Min
items.summary: Battery energy storage system (BESS) costs have plummeted to Rs 2.1 per unit from Rs 10.18 per unit, as reported to Parliament. The government is actively promoting affordability through Viability Gap Funding schemes and waivers on transmission charges. Additionally, a Production-Linked Incentive scheme aims to boost domestic manufacturing, reducing import dependency and future BESS costs.

items.title: Pahalgam Terror Attack: NIA Files Chargesheet Against 6 People, LeT, TRF
items.summary: The NIA has named Lashkar-e-Taiba headed by Hafeez Saeed, who has been designated as a global terrorist by the US as well as India, along with The Resistance Front, headed by Habibullah Malik.

items.title: Gopal Snacks CEO On Company's Plans For Expansion, Margin And Sales Expectations

He further covers the company's overall plans for expansion as well as sales and margin expectations for the same.

items.summary: Fertilizers make up 45% of the ₹41,455.39 crore of additional spending sought by the Ministry.

items.summary: The PLFS stated that the overall Labour Force Participation Rate increased to 55.8% in November, the highest level recorded since April.

items.summary: Two of its activists were jailed for staging a performance in Moscow's Christ the Savior Cathedral against Putin's return to presidency in 2012, an action that brought them international attention.

items.title: RBI doubles liquidity injection to Rs 1.5 lakh crore ahead of tax payments
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India is injecting Rs 1.5 lakh crore into the financial system. This move aims to prevent any cash crunch as advance tax and GST payments are due. The central bank is conducting a dollar-rupee buy-sell swap to add more liquidity. This action will help keep overnight interest rates stable.

items.summary: The resort will have 25 keys and is scheduled to open in 2030. The investment for the project is expected to be around ₹100 crore.

items.title: LS passes supplementary demands for grants for additional spending of Rs 41,455 crore in FY26
items.summary: The Lok Sabha has approved an additional Rs 41,455 crore in spending for the current fiscal year. This includes over Rs 18,000 crore for fertiliser subsidies and approximately Rs 9,500 crore for the Petroleum Ministry to cover oil marketing company under-recoveries. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman emphasized the necessity of supplementary demands for responsible governance.

items.title: Spotify Outage Affects Over 40,000 Users; Company Shares Update
items.summary: Problems included login errors and the Spotify application crashing when the users accessed it. Other issues that users reported included failure to stream tracks on the app.

items.title: Tata Power looks at Rs 25,000 crore annual capex till FY30: CEO Praveer Sinha
items.summary: Tata Power plans a significant capital expenditure of Rs 25,000 crore annually until FY30, with 65% dedicated to clean energy projects. The company aims to nearly triple its clean and green capacity to 20 GW by March 2031 and expand its customer base in the distribution segment to 40 million by 2030.

items.summary: The public display of the Yiha drone is also being seen as a signal highlighting Turkey’s role in supplying military hardware used by Pakistan during the conflict

items.summary: KSH International raised Rs 213 crore from anchor investors ahead of its IPO, indicating strong institutional interest. The magnet winding wires maker opens its public issue on December 16, backed by global funds and domestic mutual funds.

items.summary: Indian equities ended marginally lower as auto and financial stocks dragged amid foreign outflows, rupee weakness and trade uncertainty. Analysts see markets staying range-bound, with earnings expectations and global macro cues guiding near-term direction.

These plans target users seeking high data, entertainment, and AI services.

items.title: Bernstein stays cautious on India exposure, prefers low volatility, large-caps
items.summary: Investing.com -- Bernstein maintained a cautious stance on India exposure despite early signs of market inflection, advising against chasing small/mid-caps and high-volatility stocks. The firm reiterated its preference for large-cap and low-volatility stocks, which it views as the “cheapest” styles relative to the market and beneficiaries of strong earnings tailwinds.
